case.title: Senior Frontend Engineer — StartupX (Series B) vs Candidate cand_017
case.subtitle: Decision-support brief for a stretch-fit: Next.js gap, remote US, comp floor $160k.

confidence.coverage_note: Evidence covers core role fit; missing a direct Next.js project artifact and comp alignment confirmation.

decision_brief.decision_summary: Proceed with targeted hiring-manager outreach emphasizing frontend architecture + performance, while explicitly addressing Next.js ramp plan. Do not over-index on general React experience; verify Next.js production readiness quickly.

what_would_change.label: If Next.js experience is required to be immediate
If salary band cannot meet $160k+ base
If role demands deep startup ambiguity handling

next_actions.title: Send HM outreach message
next_actions.detail: Lead with design-system + architecture wins; propose 30–45 min call.

next_actions.title: Produce a small Next.js artifact
next_actions.detail: Build a mini app showcasing routing, data fetching, perf profiling.

next_actions.title: Clarify compensation range
next_actions.detail: Ask recruiter for base + equity + benefits range and leveling.

constraints_and_preferences.label: Time-to-credibility
constraints_and_preferences.value: 2–3 weeks for Next.js artifact + interview narratives

reasons_not_to_proceed.reason: Next.js experience gap may be a hard filter for this team.
Limited startup experience could be risky if role expects high ambiguity tolerance.
Comp may fall below required floor once base/equity is clarified.

counterfactuals.title: If team is flexible on Next.js and values architecture/mentorship
If startup context requires cross-functional scrappiness

key_claims.text: Candidate aligns strongly with frontend architecture and performance needs of the role.
Primary gap is Next.js, but can be mitigated with a focused artifact and narrative.
Startup ambiguity tolerance is uncertain; validate via targeted questions.

notes.title: Tone guidance
notes.detail: Avoid persuasion. Present evidence + uncertainty. Offer ramp plan and invite assessment.

notes.title: Interview risk
notes.detail: If onsite includes Next.js deep-dive, prep must be explicit and time-boxed.

unknowns.text: Does the team treat Next.js as a hard requirement or a preference?
Exact interview loop focus (system design vs framework trivia).

assumptions.text: Candidate can ramp on Next.js quickly due to strong React + architecture background.
Hiring manager values mentorship and design systems beyond feature delivery.

missing_info.text: Whether role includes ownership of Next.js SSR/ISR patterns day-1.

pro_queries.title: Evidence of ramp success
pro_queries.query: examples where strong React engineers ramped to Next.js quickly; what artifacts convince HMs?

pro_queries.title: Role fit signal
pro_queries.query: signals that architecture/DS leadership is valued in Series B product orgs

con_queries.title: Hard filter risk
con_queries.query: how often Series B roles list Next.js as a hard filter; what screening looks like

con_queries.title: Comp mismatch risk
con_queries.query: typical base ranges for Senior Frontend Eng at Series B remote US; variance by market

tasks.title: Ask recruiter for interview loop + must-haves
Build Next.js artifact with perf + tests
Draft HM message with evidence-backed bullets

follow_up_questions.question: What is the compensation range (base + equity) for this role?
Is Next.js required day-1, or can the candidate ramp in the first month?
What does the interview loop emphasize (architecture, performance, product, framework specifics)?

ui_hints.disclaimer: This brief supports decision-making. It does not guarantee outcomes.

items.snippet: Candidate has 8 years of enterprise React/TypeScript with performance focus; aligns with frontend architecture role theme.
Job emphasizes frontend architecture, design system leadership, and React/GraphQL stack.
Candidate gap: no Next.js; job stack includes Next.js—risk of hard filter or deep technical screen.
Limited startup experience; Series B environment may require ambiguity tolerance and rapid iteration.
Mitigation: build a small Next.js artifact demonstrating routing, data fetching, SSR/ISR basics, and perf profiling.
Salary minimum override set to $160k; comp band unknown—could be misaligned with startup range.
